snippet: If the recaptures of Ramadi, Tikrit and Falluja are a guide, Iraqi officials will confront devastation and unexploded bombs once Mosul is reclaimed....
abstract: Experts warn city of Mosul, Iraq, if recaptured from Islamic State, may be laden with hidden explosives and left in state of devastation that could take months or years to fix; conditions found in recaptured cities Ramadi, Tikrit and Falluja described.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Tim Arango reported from Erbil, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: If the recaptures of Ramadi, Tikrit and Falluja are a guide, Iraqi officials will confront devastation and unexploded bombs once Mosul is reclaimed.

headline.main: Retaking Mosul From ISIS May Pale to What Comes Next
headline.print_headline: Recapturing Mosul From ISIS May Pale to What Comes Next

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
